front.title: RTP Payload Format for MPEG-4 with Scaleable & Flexible Error Resiliency

abstract.t: This document describes a payload format, which can be used for the transport of both MPEG-4 Elementary Streams (ES) as well as MPEG-4 Sync Layer packet streams, in RTP [1] packets. The payload format allows for protection against loss in a generic way, through frag- mentation, grouping and extension data mechanisms, which can dynamically adapt to network conditions. These mechanisms can operate both on full and partial MPEG-4 Access Units, such as Sync Layer packets, or typed segments, These mechanisms can cover a broad range of protection schemes and avoid extra connection management complexity - e.g. for separate FEC channels - in MPEG-4 applications with a high number of streams.
